content: Constantly crashes while playing online.
Stops working and closes consistently every 40 seconds from reload screen (can continue where left off!), heats up phone and chews up battery life. Otherwise the rest is excellent.
Excellent digital version of the card game! I just wish they would hurry up with the expansions already! It has been awhile since they updated, so it doesn't look promising.
Game is great, need those expansions though! Hasn't been updated since 5/2019
Love it. No issues on my device. Older Huawei tablet. Really want to have the next expansion added!

The game itself is great to say the least. But often enough, cards kind of get "stuck" in the center and wond resolve, causing the match to freeze basically. You can't do anything about it or skip/cancel the action so the whole match is coming to an abrupt end. Please fix this. Playing on a Samsung Galaxy A70.
Freezes and crashes all the time.
App crashes towards end of games and you cannot resume. Slows entire phone down, really bad
This game makes my pee pee hard.
Good representation of the card game except no expansions and I am unable to play multiplayer as the app will not allow me to put in a user name. Silly bug.
Great app for the base game, very faithful and plays well, but seems development is dead. So, no expansions or future fixes. But I've never had an issue with it, and love the game and its expansions.
Fun game, but it keeps crashing and is not compatible with the Samsung keyboard
Most balanced vs card game I ever played

Game is fun and I've already placed an order for the physical version on Amazon. However I can't recommend this app to Android users since it's not compatible with the Samsung Keyboard and won't allow you to make an account. Also this app needs to be updated with the expansions.
This game is great irl, but rn the hard AI is Really hard, as in nigh unbeatable going first. That aside it's always a fun game, and should be even more interesting once its expansions come out
Can't enter text. Can't create a profile or enter an email. Can't play. Just broken.

I cant even creat an account. I am playing on a Galaxy Note 8 running most recent android. Also playing on WiFi. When I try and type my name, nothing goes through. I cant create a online account or add friends.
replyContent: Some newer samsung phones come installed with an incompatible keyboard.  Change to the default keyboard and it should work!

content: While the computer and phone games do need some work, I will always support this game and its creators. For those that dont know, the game is also a standalone card game that you play on tabletop. Currently there is the base game, and 2 expansions; Relics of the Future, and Shadow of Salvation. I highly recommend it.
The game is good but I've been waiting for the expansion for a while now and there is no word on when it's going to come out
Would have been fun but couldn't get more than a few moves in before the app would crash.
excellent game, but needs an undo button

Game keeps lagging and sometimes freezes. There is also a lot of computer foresight and "cheating" as the AI seems to get the exact cards it needs to fill out its deck. I have also seen the AI pull the same champion on the next draw 3 times in a row after I have destroyed it. Game needs to be looked at, had the AI draw out 15 cards with it only having 3 card that give card draw.

Good game, but the controls are disappointing. No visible description for cards in hand. No easy way to see effect of enemy cards. Need to click on weird place to exhaust champions. Needs more work on UI.

The game has been crashing a lot more frequently for me. Creating online games results in server disconnections. These crashes happen at random times and usually occurs in the middle of playing cards during my turn. I'm on a Galaxy S10+. The game still deserves 5 stars from me due to the incredible addictive gameplay mechanics that really pays tribute to Ascension - Just please, tune up the game.

You may or may not like the theme of Shards Of Infinity much, but the gameplay is hard to argue against. Many mechanics from the deckbuilding genre are present here, including some novel ones, and they all come together perfectly to elevate the deckbuilder genre to a higher level of complexity and competitiveness. The mobile app has been a perfect adaption of the game for me, although I would love to see the expansions!
Fun game to play with friends or vs the AI
Best deck builder I have played so far. So much fun.

Possibly the best deck-builder on the market! There are a couple other deck-builders I like on the Google Play store, but I definitely find myself playing this one the most. The game is beautiful, the screen is uncluttered, and the card descriptions are easily understandable. I am looking forward to any expansions. (The game plays wonderfully without expansions, but any additions these developers might come up with could only serve to make the game even better!)
Was really excited about this game but crashes after 2 minutes

When it works it seemed like a fun game with a few new interesting mechanics but it really does have some issues. When a game doesn't even start 9/10 times you lose interest pretty quite despite my love for deckbuilding games. Also some sort of campaign mode would be nice but I can live without that if I can reliably run the game.
Love the game but the crash or freezing bug with the medium AI still exists. Overall the game is alot of fun!

Overall, a very good recreation of the card game. I'd have rated it 5* if the Hard AI didn't cheat so blatantly. The cards it needs to buy magically appear. It almost always pairs up cards that need to be paired up while the player cards rarely do the same. That aspect is hugely disappointing.
Great app, but when will the expansion be available?
Fairly smooth and a great game, but the game frequently crashes when the ai has to make a hard decision. Generally this happens when life totals are low and order of operations matters.
Great digital version, but the gameplay doesn't strike me as much as Star Realms (sorry guys)
Excellent adaptation of the board game. Absolutely a blast to play solo against the AI.

Edit: developer offered a refund, which was greatly appreciated. Overall, game shares a lot of concepts with Star Realms, which means Shards has many of the same problems. RNG can have too big an impact, some synergies are too strong, some are too weak, and "steamrolling" is a distinct problem. Developer was very helpful via email. You might enjoy it more if you like trade row games.
replyContent: Email info@templegatesgames.com with your order id and we'll be happy to give you refund.

content: I have the physical copy of the game, plus the first expansion Relics of the Future, my friends & I get a lot of enjoyment playing this game. However, there can be some improvements of the mobile game with connection issues playing online. The multiplayer with friends vs. the A.I. is unplayable, as the A.I. is unable to process moves quickly and you are forced to quit the game. With 2nd expansion set Shadow of Salvation coming out soon, I wish the mobile game would release the 1st expansion.

I like the app, I've played it as a board game so it was easy enough to pick up. It would be nice if online multiplayer had a matching and ranking system though! if it gets it I'll definetely add the 5th star. Possible quality of life adds: It would be nice to see champions in play in an easier way but I'm guessing with the shop it wasn't too easy. Making it possible to click on logs and see what card was bought.

Love it. Absolutely stellar mechanics and card systems to customize. Id recommend it to anyone =) only big issue i had with it is that the achievements and single player content needs some work. I like achievements to sorta have goals or get rewarded for doing something, the lack of achievements really does lessen the feeling of accomplishment. Also the AI is smart and all but having something in place for single player content would be nice. I dont know, maybe a campaign?

(edit from 1 star to 4) Still don't like the game, but at least I got my refund back. Emailed them and a couple of minutes later I got the refund. So try it and if it's not for you you have nothing to lose.
replyContent: Sorry the game's not for you.  Email info@templegatesgames.com and we can give you a refund!

content: love the game. very fun and fast paced deck builder. has a good number of ways to reach victory so strategy and awareness are key. would rate this app a 5 star if it wouldn't crash so often when switching between fights
Awesome game, awesome app. Like Ascension sometimes the app will freeze if the AI is playing fast and a lot of cards. Thats really my only complaint, its so good!
Fantastic deck-builder! Endless playability. Can't wait for the expansions!
Having to bring up the champions pressing an icon is a bit annoying but it works. Excellent digital implementation of the physical card game. Can't wait for the expansion to be added.
great game I love this game rating 4 due to how often it crashes and the expansion not being out yet lol.
Best deck building game ever

I'm a big fan of the game Ascension and Shards of Infinty is also a favorite. The PvP works well and the gameplay is a good mix of strategy and chance. Can't wait for the expansion to be available. Online works well and playing against the AI is a good challenge. It would be nice to have 15 min games online with timed turns. The background visuals are very cool.
its cheesy

amazing game really and the strategies you can have based on the cards. it's one of the top cards games. it's the best deck building game I ever got. I have the actual cards game and the android version and i totally love it
excellent basic deck builder
the game itself is amazing but... non stop crashing non stop errors needs much work no customer support and no easy way to add in game friends

The issue I want to address is the sound mix. The attack/shield sound is WAY too loud in relation to the other game sounds. Please turn it down. Second, the recycled sounds from Race for the galaxy sound out of place and awkward. This is a different game so how about using some different sounds?  Otherwise, this is a fantastic game! Get it.
great digital adaptation of the follow up deckbuilding game from the makers of ascension
love it

The game is excellent, but the implementation loses a couple of stars for a few issues: one the game locks up frequently when playing the Hard AI, and the closer the game the more likely it is to lock up. The game doesn't support any customization for extra players in local games. It's annoying for a frequent pass-and-play player to have to be "player 1" all them time
This is a fantastic digital card game. First mobile game in a long time that I just keep playing over and over again. It's fun trying to beat the Hard AI, and there are multiple strategies to try.

Pretty decent game so far, the 2 player version at least. Easy to beat three hard AIs by just going for shards, defense, and health. May just be a deficiency in the AI, I haven't tried this strategy against other players yet. The hard AI is quite good 1 on 1 though, I've yet to beat it.

I was very excited to play this game because I love ascension. However it is currently not stable on my device. I experienced 4 crashes in 4 attempts to play over the course of about 10 mins. Thankfully (I guess) the issues came up quickly allowing me time to request a refund. I chose a neutral rating because if the game was stable for me I think I would have really enjoyed it, please do your best to fix this. I look forward to playing once this is resolved
just like the card game, with a pretty well made AI

was in the middle of a match, lost connection. afterwards, now it wont let me go online at all, despite being online. i can watch youtube, netflix, and hulu just fine, but it wont let me play this game online at all now.

I've had it now for a week, and am completely addicted to it. As a game, it is a nice mix of (mostly) star realms and ascension. It's probably personal, but for me it's the absolute best, as mercenaries and focus fill in parts I see as disadvantages of those games (the "I want the effect but not want it in my deck" and the "what do I do with my spare change?").  Perhaps I'm not as good at deck building, but to me the medium AI provides a nice 50/50 challenge, whereas the hard AI just beats me all but one time. To my own surprise, this game holds up pretty well with 3 and 4 players. It doesn't devolve into "all defense and level up". But make no mistake: that infinity shard isn't just a gimmick. It's tough to make it to level 30, but a valid strategy.  That said...not only is this a (IMHO) absolutely great game, but it's made by the team that made the race for the galaxy app. And it shows: the interface is slick, responsive and intuitive (hint: use the 'large text' option! :-) ) and overall a joy to play. Yes, I also had two random crashes. But on nearly 50 games (and both being able to resume the game after restarting), I really can't complain.  So: great game. Well worth it

Game still crashes after opponents turn at times. Overall a pretty good game in need of more depth. Really needs either another faction, another type of card or some sort of progression system to make it a top tier game. Hopefully expansions will fix this problem. For now it's a fine game, which is just not quite enough with all the compition these days.
replyContent: Hi, Sorry about this. There's a bug with Med AI that's fixed in 1634, but that's not quite what you're describing... We don't have any crash reports from your device/os/version, so if you could 'report the error' after the crash, we'll take a look at it (or maybe it just hasn't gone through). Any other info please send to info@templegatesgames.com.

content: This just isnt working on my phone. I open it and do a couple things and then it just stops responding. It doesnt freeze entirely, but I can't exit or do anything.
Great game with the chance to have multiple games at once. The expansion would be wonderful but I hope they fix the crashing soon. The AI keeps lagging when I switch from multiple games, though.

A wary 5* as this is a good game and, in my experience to date, a stable one. But I almost deducted one for a couple of reasons. Firstly, while Shards is indeed a fairly obvious mix of Ascension and Star Realms style mechanics, I don't think that actually produces a better game than either; if you include one of the later Ascension expansions, anyway. Secondly, on a tablet I ought to be able to read the card text without having to expand it. I can on both other games, so why not Shards?

A promising game, but I think it needs an expansion to be more challenging. After just a few games I'm familiar with all cards and the hard AI is not very tough. Perhaps this is a game that is best against human opponents, which I don't enjoy. I will keep ny eyes open for an expansion.

Participated in the beta. The developers are quite responsive to any issues being brought up, and have fixed issues promptly. I have the physical copy of the game, which is a lot of fun. I like it better than Star Realms. The digital implementation is quite good. Fast-paced, smooth animations, much better AI now too.
keeps crashing
impressively fast, perfect for practicing strategies to test on others in app or with the physical game.

The game ia great, its like a mix between the best of Ascension and Star Realms. However, if I could change one thing I would request a game mode / option that would allow us to play without Shards of Infinity in peoples decks. I'd like to try it as a slower struggle without a built in end button.
The game opens fast and runs great. The ability to play and set the timer to unlimited is great. My buddy and I can play as we get a chance. The app notifies you when it's your turn.
really fun game. simple but deep.
great game fun to play on your own or with friend. highly recommend
No problems with the game itself, seems great. I'm on a Pixel 2XL and the buttons in the corners (to view champions and access the menu) aren't always responsive.
This game is so smooth. I don't think I want to play the physical version after having played this. Just wish the AI was more difficult.
Really fun to play. Interesting mechanics.
good!

My new addiction since Ascension. Comments: background flickers on Fire HD; would really like a representation of shields on the player bar; really need to be able to increase health levels (like in Ascension) to make banishing relevant. Excellent job. As with Ascension, I'd really like the game to track and display player statistics over time.
liking it so far, fast paced and everything plays just like the real deal.

Latest update is obnoxious: confirming card buy, play, banish, focus, etc makes the game grind to a terrible halt. please allow for an option to disable this. /edit: found the problem: cursor and touch controls are reversed
replyContent: Sorry about this. I don't quite understand your post, you don't ever confirm buy/play/focus.  Banish is confirmed only from in hand. The update added the 'touchscreen' controls option (which android devices use by default) which favors dragging cards or you can go to the 'cursor' control scheme (prob not the best name) that works as before.
